are no matches or only partial matches.

ml.get_overall_buckets#bucket_span.name: bucket_span
ml.get_overall_buckets#bucket_span.description:
The span of the overall buckets. Must be greater or equal to the largest
bucket span of the specified anomaly detection jobs, which is the default
value.

By default, an overall bucket has a span equal to the largest bucket span
of the specified anomaly detection jobs. To override that behavior, use
the optional `bucket_span` parameter.

ml.get_overall_buckets#end.name: end
ml.get_overall_buckets#end.description: Returns overall buckets with timestamps earlier than this time.

ml.get_overall_buckets#exclude_interim.name: exclude_interim
ml.get_overall_buckets#exclude_interim.description: If `true`, the output excludes interim results.

ml.get_overall_buckets#overall_score.name: overall_score
ml.get_overall_buckets#overall_score.description:
Returns overall buckets with overall scores greater than or equal to this
value.

ml.get_overall_buckets#start.name: start
ml.get_overall_buckets#start.description: Returns overall buckets with timestamps after this time.

ml.get_overall_buckets#top_n.name: top_n
ml.get_overall_buckets#top_n.description:
The number of top anomaly detection job bucket scores to be used in the
`overall_score` calculation.

ml.get_trained_models#model_id.name: model_id
ml.get_trained_models#model_id.description:
The unique identifier of the trained model or a model alias.

You can get information for multiple trained models in a single API
request by using a comma-separated list of model IDs or a wildcard
expression.

ml.get_trained_models#allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_trained_models#allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

- Contains wildcard expressions and there are no models that match.
- Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
- Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If true, it returns an empty array when there are no matches and the
subset of results when there are partial matches.

ml.get_trained_models#decompress_definit.name: decompress_definition
ml.get_trained_models#decompress_definit.description:
Specifies whether the included model definition should be returned as a
JSON map (true) or in a custom compressed format (false).

ml.get_trained_models#exclude_generated.name: exclude_generated
ml.get_trained_models#exclude_generated.description:
Indicates if certain fields should be removed from the configuration on
retrieval. This allows the configuration to be in an acceptable format to
be retrieved and then added to another cluster.

ml.get_trained_models#from.name: from
ml.get_trained_models#from.description: Skips the specified number of models.

ml.get_trained_models#include.name: include
ml.get_trained_models#include.description:
A comma delimited string of optional fields to include in the response
body.

ml.get_trained_models#size.name: size
ml.get_trained_models#size.description: Specifies the maximum number of models to obtain.

ml.get_trained_models#tags.name: tags
ml.get_trained_models#tags.description:
A comma delimited string of tags. A trained model can have many tags, or
none. When supplied, only trained models that contain all the supplied
tags are returned.

ml.get_trained_models_stats#model_id.name: model_id
ml.get_trained_models_stats#model_id.description:
The unique identifier of the trained model or a model alias. It can be a
comma-separated list or a wildcard expression.

ml.get_trained_models_stats#allow_no_mat.name: allow_no_match
ml.get_trained_models_stats#allow_no_mat.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

- Contains wildcard expressions and there are no models that match.
- Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
- Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If true, it returns an empty array when there are no matches and the
subset of results when there are partial matches.

ml.get_trained_models_stats#from.name: from
ml.get_trained_models_stats#from.description: Skips the specified number of models.

ml.get_trained_models_stats#size.name: size
ml.get_trained_models_stats#size.description: Specifies the maximum number of models to obtain.

ml.infer_trained_model#model_id.name: model_id
ml.infer_trained_model#model_id.description: The unique identifier of the trained model.

ml.infer_trained_model#timeout.name: timeout
ml.infer_trained_model#timeout.description: Controls the amount of time to wait for inference results.

ml.preview_data_frame_analytics#id.name: id
ml.preview_data_frame_analytics#id.description: Identifier for the data frame analytics job.

ml.preview_datafeed#datafeed_id.name: datafeed_id
ml.preview_datafeed#datafeed_id.description:
A numerical character string that uniquely identifies the datafeed. This identifier can contain lowercase
alphanumeric characters (a-z and 0-9), hyphens, and underscores. It must start and end with alphanumeric
characters. NOTE: If you use this path parameter, you cannot provide datafeed or anomaly detection job
configuration details in the request body.

ml.preview_datafeed#start.name: start
ml.preview_datafeed#start.description: The start time from where the datafeed preview should begin

ml.preview_datafeed#end.name: end
ml.preview_datafeed#end.description: The end time when the datafeed preview should stop

msearch#index.name: index
msearch#index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases to search.

msearch#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
msearch#allow_no_indices.description: If false, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or _all value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request targeting foo*,bar* returns an error if an index starts with foo but no index starts with bar.

msearch#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
msearch#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If true, network roundtrips between the coordinating node and remote clusters are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

msearch#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
msearch#expand_wildcards.description: Type of index that wildcard expressions can match. If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.

msearch#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
msearch#ignore_throttled.description: If true, concrete, expanded or aliased indices are ignored when frozen.

msearch#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
msearch#ignore_unavailable.description: If true, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

msearch#max_concurrent_searches.name: max_concurrent_searches
msearch#max_concurrent_searches.description: Maximum number of concurrent searches the multi search API can execute.

msearch#max_concurrent_shard_requests.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
msearch#max_concurrent_shard_requests.description: Maximum number of concurrent shard requests that each sub-search request executes per node.

msearch#pre_filter_shard_size.name: pre_filter_shard_size
msearch#pre_filter_shard_size.description: Defines a threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on its rewrite method i.e., if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

msearch#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
msearch#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, hits.total are returned as an integer in the response. Defaults to false, which returns an object.

msearch#routing.name: routing
msearch#routing.description: Custom routing value used to route search operations to a specific shard.

msearch#search_type.name: search_type
msearch#search_type.description: Indicates whether global term and document frequencies should be used when scoring returned documents.

msearch#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
msearch#typed_keys.description: Specifies whether aggregation and suggester names should be prefixed by their respective types in the response.

msearch_template#index.name: index
msearch_template#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*`.

msearch_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
msearch_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If `true`, network round-trips are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

msearch_template#max_concurrent_searches.name: max_concurrent_searches
msearch_template#max_concurrent_searches.description: Maximum number of concurrent searches the API can run.

msearch_template#search_type.name: search_type
msearch_template#search_type.description:
The type of the search operation.
Available options: `query_then_fetch`, `dfs_query_then_fetch`.

msearch_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
msearch_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.description:
If `true`, the response returns `hits.total` as an integer.
If `false`, it returns `hits.total` as an object.

msearch_template#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
msearch_template#typed_keys.description: If `true`, the response prefixes aggregation and suggester names with their respective types.

mtermvectors#index.name: index
mtermvectors#index.description: Name of the index that contains the documents.

mtermvectors#ids.name: ids
mtermvectors#ids.description: A comma-separated list of documents ids. You must define ids as parameter or set "ids" or "docs" in the request body

mtermvectors#fields.name: fields
mtermvectors#fields.description:
Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.
Used as the default list unless a specific field list is provided in the `completion_fields` or `fielddata_fields` parameters.

mtermvectors#field_statistics.name: field_statistics
mtermvectors#field_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes the document count, sum of document frequencies, and sum of total term frequencies.

mtermvectors#offsets.name: offsets
mtermvectors#offsets.description: If `true`, the response includes term offsets.

mtermvectors#payloads.name: payloads
mtermvectors#payloads.description: If `true`, the response includes term payloads.

mtermvectors#positions.name: positions
mtermvectors#positions.description: If `true`, the response includes term positions.

mtermvectors#preference.name: preference
mtermvectors#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

mtermvectors#realtime.name: realtime
mtermvectors#realtime.description: If true, the request is real-time as opposed to near-real-time.

mtermvectors#routing.name: routing
mtermvectors#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

mtermvectors#term_statistics.name: term_statistics
mtermvectors#term_statistics.description: If true, the response includes term frequency and document frequency.

mtermvectors#version.name: version
mtermvectors#version.description: If `true`, returns the document version as part of a hit.

put_script#id.name: id
put_script#id.description:
Identifier for the stored script or search template.
Must be unique within the cluster.

put_script#context.name: context
put_script#context.description:
Context in which the script or search template should run.
To prevent errors, the API immediately compiles the script or template in this context.

put_script#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
put_script#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

put_script#timeout.name: timeout
put_script#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

rank_eval#index.name: index
rank_eval#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request. Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.
To target all data streams and indices in a cluster, omit this parameter or use `_all` or `*`.

rank_eval#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
rank_eval#allow_no_indices.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

rank_eval#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
rank_eval#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

rank_eval#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
rank_eval#ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

render_search_template#id.name: id
render_search_template#id.description:
ID of the search template to render.
If no `source` is specified, this or the `id` request body parameter is required.

scroll#scroll.name: scroll
scroll#scroll.description: Period to retain the search context for scrolling.

scroll#scroll_id_.name: scroll_id
scroll#scroll_id_.description: The scroll ID for scrolled search

scroll#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
scroll#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, the API responseâ€™s hit.total property is returned as an integer. If false, the API responseâ€™s hit.total property is returned as an object.

search#index.name: index
search#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

search#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search#allow_partial_search_results.name: allow_partial_search_results
search#allow_partial_search_results.description: If true, returns partial results if there are shard request timeouts or shard failures. If false, returns an error with no partial results.

search#analyzer.name: analyzer
search#analyzer.description:
Analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
search#analyze_wildcard.description:
If true, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#batched_reduce_size.name: batched_reduce_size
search#batched_reduce_size.description:
The number of shard results that should be reduced at once on the coordinating node.
This value should be used as a protection mechanism to reduce the memory overhead per search request if the potential number of shards in the request can be large.

search#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
search#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If true, network round-trips between the coordinating node and the remote clusters are minimized when executing cross-cluster search (CCS) requests.

search#default_operator.name: default_operator
search#default_operator.description:
The default operator for query string query: AND or OR.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search#df.name: df
search#df.description:
Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the q query string parameter is specified.

search#docvalue_fields.name: docvalue_fields
search#docvalue_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return as the docvalue representation for each hit.

search#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

search#explain.name: explain
search#explain.description: If `true`, returns detailed information about score computation as part of a hit.

search#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
search#ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, concrete, expanded or aliased indices will be ignored when frozen.

search#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search#lenient.name: lenient
search#lenient.description:
If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

search#max_concurrent_shard_requests.name: max_concurrent_shard_requests
search#max_concurrent_shard_requests.description:
Defines the number of concurrent shard requests per node this search executes concurrently.
This value should be used to limit the impact of the search on the cluster in order to limit the number of concurrent shard requests.

search#min_compatible_shard_node.name: min_compatible_shard_node
search#min_compatible_shard_node.description:
The minimum version of the node that can handle the request
Any handling node with a lower version will fail the request.

search#preference.name: preference

search#pre_filter_shard_size.name: pre_filter_shard_size

search#request_cache.name: request_cache
search#request_cache.description:
If `true`, the caching of search results is enabled for requests where `size` is `0`.
Defaults to index level settings.

search#routing.name: routing
search#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search#scroll.name: scroll
search#scroll.description:
Period to retain the search context for scrolling. See Scroll search results.
By default, this value cannot exceed `1d` (24 hours).
You can change this limit using the `search.max_keep_alive` cluster-level setting.

search#search_type.name: search_type
search#search_type.description: How distributed term frequencies are calculated for relevance scoring.

search#stats.name: stats
search#stats.description: Specific `tag` of the request for logging and statistical purposes.

search#stored_fields.name: stored_fields
search#stored_fields.description:
A comma-separated list of stored fields to return as part of a hit.
If no fields are specified, no stored fields are included in the response.
If this field is specified, the `_source` parameter defaults to `false`.
You can pass `_source: true` to return both source fields and stored fields in the search response.

search#suggest_field.name: suggest_field
search#suggest_field.description: Specifies which field to use for suggestions.

search#suggest_mode.name: suggest_mode
search#suggest_mode.description:
Specifies the suggest mode.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#suggest_size.name: suggest_size
search#suggest_size.description:
Number of suggestions to return.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#suggest_text.name: suggest_text
search#suggest_text.description:
The source text for which the suggestions should be returned.
This parameter can only be used when the `suggest_field` and `suggest_text` query string parameters are specified.

search#terminate_after.name: terminate_after
search#terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Elasticsearch terminates the query early.
Elasticsearch collects documents before sorting.
Use with caution.
Elasticsearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Elasticsearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.
If set to `0` (default), the query does not terminate early.

search#timeout.name: timeout
search#timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for a response from each shard.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

search#track_total_hits.name: track_total_hits
search#track_total_hits.description:
Number of hits matching the query to count accurately.
If `true`, the exact number of hits is returned at the cost of some performance.
If `false`, the response does not include the total number of hits matching the query.

search#track_scores.name: track_scores
search#track_scores.description: If `true`, calculate and return document scores, even if the scores are not used for sorting.

search#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search#typed_keys.description: If `true`, aggregation and suggester names are be prefixed by their respective types in the response.

search#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
search#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: Indicates whether `hits.total` should be rendered as an integer or an object in the rest search response.

search#version.name: version
search#version.description: If `true`, returns document version as part of a hit.

search#_source.name: _source

search#_source_excludes.name: _source_excludes
search#_source_excludes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to exclude from the response.
You can also use this parameter to exclude fields from the subset specified in `_source_includes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

search#_source_includes.name: _source_includes
search#_source_includes.description:
A comma-separated list of source fields to include in the response.
If this parameter is specified, only these source fields are returned.
You can exclude fields from this subset using the `_source_excludes` query parameter.
If the `_source` parameter is `false`, this parameter is ignored.

search#seq_no_primary_term.name: seq_no_primary_term
search#seq_no_primary_term.description: If `true`, returns sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit.

search#q.name: q
search#q.description:
Query in the Lucene query string syntax using query parameter search.
Query parameter searches do not support the full Elasticsearch Query DSL but are handy for testing.

search#size.name: size
search#size.description:
Defines the number of hits to return.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

search#from.name: from
search#from.description:
Starting document offset.
Needs to be non-negative.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

search_application.get_behavioral_analyt.name: name
search_application.get_behavioral_analyt.description: A list of analytics collections to limit the returned information

search_application.search#name.name: name
search_application.search#name.description: The name of the search application to be searched.

search_application.search#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search_application.search#typed_keys.description: Determines whether aggregation names are prefixed by their respective types in the response.

search_mvt#index.name: index
search_mvt#index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, or aliases to search

search_mvt#field.name: field
search_mvt#field.description: Field containing geospatial data to return

search_mvt#zoom.name: zoom
search_mvt#zoom.description: Zoom level for the vector tile to search

search_mvt#x.name: x
search_mvt#x.description: X coordinate for the vector tile to search

search_mvt#y.name: y
search_mvt#y.description: Y coordinate for the vector tile to search

search_mvt#exact_bounds.name: exact_bounds
search_mvt#exact_bounds.description:
If false, the meta layerâ€™s feature is the bounding box of the tile.
If true, the meta layerâ€™s feature is a bounding box resulting from a
geo_bounds aggregation. The aggregation runs on <field> values that intersect
the <zoom>/<x>/<y> tile with wrap_longitude set to false. The resulting
bounding box may be larger than the vector tile.

search_mvt#extent.name: extent
search_mvt#extent.description: Size, in pixels, of a side of the tile. Vector tiles are square with equal sides.

search_mvt#grid_agg.name: grid_agg
search_mvt#grid_agg.description: Aggregation used to create a grid for `field`.

search_mvt#grid_precision.name: grid_precision
search_mvt#grid_precision.description:
Additional zoom levels available through the aggs layer. For example, if <zoom> is 7
and grid_precision is 8, you can zoom in up to level 15. Accepts 0-8. If 0, results
donâ€™t include the aggs layer.

search_mvt#grid_type.name: grid_type
search_mvt#grid_type.description:
Determines the geometry type for features in the aggs layer. In the aggs layer,
each feature represents a geotile_grid cell. If 'grid' each feature is a Polygon
of the cells bounding box. If 'point' each feature is a Point that is the centroid
of the cell.

search_mvt#size.name: size
search_mvt#size.description:
Maximum number of features to return in the hits layer. Accepts 0-10000.
If 0, results donâ€™t include the hits layer.

search_mvt#with_labels.name: with_labels
search_mvt#with_labels.description:
If `true`, the hits and aggs layers will contain additional point features representing
suggested label positions for the original features.

search_template#index.name: index
search_template#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices,
and aliases to search. Supports wildcards (*).

search_template#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
search_template#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.
For example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

search_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.name: ccs_minimize_roundtrips
search_template#ccs_minimize_roundtrips.description: If `true`, network round-trips are minimized for cross-cluster search requests.

search_template#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
search_template#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

search_template#explain.name: explain
search_template#explain.description: If `true`, the response includes additional details about score computation as part of a hit.

search_template#ignore_throttled.name: ignore_throttled
search_template#ignore_throttled.description: If `true`, specified concrete, expanded, or aliased indices are not included in the response when throttled.

search_template#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
search_template#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

search_template#preference.name: preference
search_template#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

search_template#profile.name: profile
search_template#profile.description: If `true`, the query execution is profiled.

search_template#routing.name: routing
search_template#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

search_template#scroll.name: scroll
search_template#scroll.description:
Specifies how long a consistent view of the index
should be maintained for scrolled search.

search_template#search_type.name: search_type
search_template#search_type.description: The type of the search operation.

search_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.name: rest_total_hits_as_int
search_template#rest_total_hits_as_int.description: If true, hits.total are rendered as an integer in the response.

search_template#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
search_template#typed_keys.description: If `true`, the response prefixes aggregation and suggester names with their respective types.

security.create_api_key#refresh.name: refresh
security.create_api_key#refresh.description: If `true` (the default) then refresh the affected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` then do nothing with refreshes.

security.query_api_keys#with_limited_by.name: with_limited_by
security.query_api_keys#with_limited_by.description:
Return the snapshot of the owner user's role descriptors associated with the API key.
An API key's actual permission is the intersection of its assigned role descriptors and the owner user's role descriptors.

security.query_api_keys#with_profile_uid.name: with_profile_uid
security.query_api_keys#with_profile_uid.description: Determines whether to also retrieve the profile uid, for the API key owner principal, if it exists.

security.query_api_keys#typed_keys.name: typed_keys
security.query_api_keys#typed_keys.description: Determines whether aggregation names are prefixed by their respective types in the response.

terms_enum#index.name: index
terms_enum#index.description: Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases to search. Wildcard (*) expressions are supported.

termvectors#index.name: index
termvectors#index.description: Name of the index that contains the document.

termvectors#fields.name: fields
termvectors#fields.description:
Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.
Used as the default list unless a specific field list is provided in the `completion_fields` or `fielddata_fields` parameters.

termvectors#field_statistics.name: field_statistics
termvectors#field_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes the document count, sum of document frequencies, and sum of total term frequencies.

termvectors#offsets.name: offsets
termvectors#offsets.description: If `true`, the response includes term offsets.

termvectors#payloads.name: payloads
termvectors#payloads.description: If `true`, the response includes term payloads.

termvectors#positions.name: positions
termvectors#positions.description: If `true`, the response includes term positions.

termvectors#preference.name: preference
termvectors#preference.description:
Specifies the node or shard the operation should be performed on.
Random by default.

termvectors#realtime.name: realtime
termvectors#realtime.description: If true, the request is real-time as opposed to near-real-time.

termvectors#routing.name: routing
termvectors#routing.description: Custom value used to route operations to a specific shard.

termvectors#term_statistics.name: term_statistics
termvectors#term_statistics.description: If `true`, the response includes term frequency and document frequency.

termvectors#version.name: version
termvectors#version.description: If `true`, returns the document version as part of a hit.

transform.get_transform#transform_id.name: transform_id
transform.get_transform#transform_id.description:
Identifier for the transform. It can be a transform identifier or a
wildcard expression. You can get information for all transforms by using
`_all`, by specifying `*` as the `<transform_id>`, or by omitting the
`<transform_id>`.

transform.get_transform#allow_no_match.name: allow_no_match
transform.get_transform#allow_no_match.description:
Specifies what to do when the request:

1. Contains wildcard expressions and there are no transforms that match.
2. Contains the _all string or no identifiers and there are no matches.
3. Contains wildcard expressions and there are only partial matches.

If this parameter is false, the request returns a 404 status code when
there are no matches or only partial matches.

transform.get_transform#from.name: from
transform.get_transform#from.description: Skips the specified number of transforms.

transform.get_transform#size.name: size
transform.get_transform#size.description: Specifies the maximum number of transforms to obtain.

transform.get_transform#exclude_generate.name: exclude_generated
transform.get_transform#exclude_generate.description:
Excludes fields that were automatically added when creating the
transform. This allows the configuration to be in an acceptable format to
be retrieved and then added to another cluster.

transform.preview_transform#transform_id.name: transform_id
transform.preview_transform#transform_id.description:
Identifier for the transform to preview. If you specify this path parameter, you cannot provide transform
configuration details in the request body.

transform.preview_transform#timeout.name: timeout
transform.preview_transform#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the
timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

explain.description: If true, returns detailed information about score computation as part of a hit.

ext.description: Configuration of search extensions defined by Elasticsearch plugins.

from.description:
Starting document offset. By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000
hits using the from and size parameters. To page through more hits, use the
search_after parameter.

indices_boost.description: Boosts the _score of documents from specified indices.

docvalue_fields.description:
Array of wildcard (*) patterns. The request returns doc values for field
names matching these patterns in the hits.fields property of the response.

knn.description: Defines the approximate kNN search to run.

min_score.description:
Minimum _score for matching documents. Documents with a lower _score are
not included in the search results.

script_fields.description: Retrieve a script evaluation (based on different fields) for each hit.

size.description:
The number of hits to return. By default, you cannot page through more
than 10,000 hits using the from and size parameters. To page through more
hits, use the search_after parameter.

fields.description:
Array of wildcard (*) patterns. The request returns values for field names
matching these patterns in the hits.fields property of the response.

terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard. If a query reaches this
limit, Elasticsearch terminates the query early. Elasticsearch collects documents
before sorting. Defaults to 0, which does not terminate query execution early.

timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for a response from each shard. If no response
is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
Defaults to no timeout.

track_scores.description: If true, calculate and return document scores, even if the scores are not used for sorting.

version.description: If true, returns document version as part of a hit.

seq_no_primary_term.description:
If true, returns sequence number and primary term of the last modification
of each hit. See Optimistic concurrency control.

stats.description:
Stats groups to associate with the search. Each group maintains a statistics
aggregation for its associated searches. You can retrieve these stats using
the indices stats API.

deprecated.description:
Marks this index template as deprecated. When creating or updating a non-deprecated index template
that uses deprecated components, Elasticsearch will emit a deprecation warning.

query.description: EQL query you wish to run.

filter.description: Query, written in Query DSL, used to filter the events on which the EQL query runs.

fields.description: Array of wildcard (*) patterns. The response returns values for field names matching these patterns in the fields property of each hit.

vertices.description: Specifies one or more fields that contain the terms you want to include in the graph as vertices.

analyzer.description:
The name of the analyzer that should be applied to the provided `text`.
This could be a built-in analyzer, or an analyzer thatâ€™s been configured in the index.

attributes.description: Array of token attributes used to filter the output of the `explain` parameter.

char_filter.description: Array of character filters used to preprocess characters before the tokenizer.

explain.description: If `true`, the response includes token attributes and additional details.

filter.description: Array of token filters used to apply after the tokenizer.

normalizer.description: Normalizer to use to convert text into a single token.

is_write_index.description:
If `true`, sets the write index or data stream for the alias.
If an alias points to multiple indices or data streams and `is_write_index` isnâ€™t set, the alias rejects write requests.
If an index alias points to one index and `is_write_index` isnâ€™t set, the index automatically acts as the write index.
Data stream aliases donâ€™t automatically set a write data stream, even if the alias points to one data stream.

composed_of.description:
An ordered list of component template names.
Component templates are merged in the order specified, meaning that the last component template specified has the highest precedence.

priority.description:
Priority to determine index template precedence when a new data stream or index is created.
The index template with the highest priority is chosen.
If no priority is specified the template is treated as though it is of priority 0 (lowest priority).
This number is not automatically generated by Elasticsearch.

allow_auto_create.description:
This setting overrides the value of the `action.auto_create_index` cluster setting.
If set to `true` in a template, then indices can be automatically created using that template even if auto-creation of indices is disabled via `actions.auto_create_index`.
If set to `false`, then indices or data streams matching the template must always be explicitly created, and may never be automatically created.

ignore_missing_component_templates.description:
The configuration option ignore_missing_component_templates can be used when an index template
references a component template that might not exist

deprecated.description:
Marks this index template as deprecated. When creating or updating a non-deprecated index template
that uses deprecated components, Elasticsearch will emit a deprecation warning.

date_detection.description: Controls whether dynamic date detection is enabled.

dynamic_date_formats.description:
If date detection is enabled then new string fields are checked
against 'dynamic_date_formats' and if the value matches then
a new date field is added instead of string.

dynamic_templates.description: Specify dynamic templates for the mapping.

numeric_detection.description: Automatically map strings into numeric data types for all fields.

properties.description:
Mapping for a field. For new fields, this mapping can include:

- Field name
- Field data type
- Mapping parameters

index_patterns.description:
Array of wildcard expressions used to match the names
of indices during creation.

order.description:
Order in which Elasticsearch applies this template if index
matches multiple templates.

Templates with lower 'order' values are merged first. Templates with higher
'order' values are merged later, overriding templates with lower values.

aliases.description:
Aliases for the target index.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

settings.description:
Configuration options for the index.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

allow_auto_create.description:
This setting overrides the value of the `action.auto_create_index` cluster setting.
If set to `true` in a template, then indices can be automatically created using that template even if auto-creation of indices is disabled via `actions.auto_create_index`.
If set to `false`, then indices or data streams matching the template must always be explicitly created, and may never be automatically created.

composed_of.description:
An ordered list of component template names.
Component templates are merged in the order specified, meaning that the last component template specified has the highest precedence.

priority.description:
Priority to determine index template precedence when a new data stream or index is created.
The index template with the highest priority is chosen.
If no priority is specified the template is treated as though it is of priority 0 (lowest priority).
This number is not automatically generated by Elasticsearch.

ignore_missing_component_templates.description:
The configuration option ignore_missing_component_templates can be used when an index template
references a component template that might not exist

deprecated.description:
Marks this index template as deprecated. When creating or updating a non-deprecated index template
that uses deprecated components, Elasticsearch will emit a deprecation warning.

query.description:
Query input, required for rerank task.
Not required for other tasks.

input.description:
Inference input.
Either a string or an array of strings.

docs.description: Sample documents to test in the pipeline.
The documents you want to retrieve. Required if no index is specified in the request URI.

allow_no_match.description: Refer to the description for the `allow_no_match` query parameter.

exclude_interim.description: Refer to the description for the `exclude_interim` query parameter.

overall_score.description: Refer to the description for the `overall_score` query parameter.

top_n.description: Refer to the description for the `top_n` query parameter.

docs.description:
An array of objects to pass to the model for inference. The objects should contain a fields matching your
configured trained model input. Typically, for NLP models, the field name is `text_field`.
Currently, for NLP models, only a single value is allowed.
Array of existing or artificial documents.

ids.description: Simplified syntax to specify documents by their ID if they're in the same index.

requests.description: A set of typical search requests, together with their provided ratings.

params.description:
Key-value pairs used to replace Mustache variables in the template.
The key is the variable name.
The value is the variable value.

source.description:
An inline search template.
Supports the same parameters as the search API's request body.
These parameters also support Mustache variables.
If no `id` or `<templated-id>` is specified, this parameter is required.

context.description: The context that the script should run in.

aggregations.description: Defines the aggregations that are run as part of the search request.

explain.description: If true, returns detailed information about score computation as part of a hit.

ext.description: Configuration of search extensions defined by Elasticsearch plugins.

from.description:
Starting document offset.
Needs to be non-negative.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

indices_boost.description: Boosts the _score of documents from specified indices.

docvalue_fields.description:
Array of wildcard (`*`) patterns.
The request returns doc values for field names matching these patterns in the `hits.fields` property of the response.

knn.description: Defines the approximate kNN search to run.

min_score.description:
Minimum `_score` for matching documents.
Documents with a lower `_score` are not included in the search results.

profile.description:
Set to `true` to return detailed timing information about the execution of individual components in a search request.
NOTE: This is a debugging tool and adds significant overhead to search execution.

rescore.description: Can be used to improve precision by reordering just the top (for example 100 - 500) documents returned by the `query` and `post_filter` phases.

script_fields.description: Retrieve a script evaluation (based on different fields) for each hit.

size.description:
The number of hits to return.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

fields.description:
Array of wildcard (`*`) patterns.
The request returns values for field names matching these patterns in the `hits.fields` property of the response.

terminate_after.description:
Maximum number of documents to collect for each shard.
If a query reaches this limit, Elasticsearch terminates the query early.
Elasticsearch collects documents before sorting.
Use with caution.
Elasticsearch applies this parameter to each shard handling the request.
When possible, let Elasticsearch perform early termination automatically.
Avoid specifying this parameter for requests that target data streams with backing indices across multiple data tiers.
If set to `0` (default), the query does not terminate early.

timeout.description:
Specifies the period of time to wait for a response from each shard.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
Defaults to no timeout.

track_scores.description: If true, calculate and return document scores, even if the scores are not used for sorting.

version.description: If true, returns document version as part of a hit.

seq_no_primary_term.description: If `true`, returns sequence number and primary term of the last modification of each hit.

stats.description:
Stats groups to associate with the search.
Each group maintains a statistics aggregation for its associated searches.
You can retrieve these stats using the indices stats API.

params.description: Query parameters specific to this request, which will override any defaults specified in the template.

aggs.description:
Sub-aggregations for the geotile_grid.

Supports the following aggregation types:
- avg
- cardinality
- max
- min
- sum

buffer.description:
Size, in pixels, of a clipping buffer outside the tile. This allows renderers
to avoid outline artifacts from geometries that extend past the extent of the tile.

exact_bounds.description:
If false, the meta layerâ€™s feature is the bounding box of the tile.
If true, the meta layerâ€™s feature is a bounding box resulting from a
geo_bounds aggregation. The aggregation runs on <field> values that intersect
the <zoom>/<x>/<y> tile with wrap_longitude set to false. The resulting
bounding box may be larger than the vector tile.

extent.description: Size, in pixels, of a side of the tile. Vector tiles are square with equal sides.

grid_precision.description:
Additional zoom levels available through the aggs layer. For example, if <zoom> is 7
and grid_precision is 8, you can zoom in up to level 15. Accepts 0-8. If 0, results
donâ€™t include the aggs layer.

size.description:
Maximum number of features to return in the hits layer. Accepts 0-10000.
If 0, results donâ€™t include the hits layer.

with_labels.description:
If `true`, the hits and aggs layers will contain additional point features representing
suggested label positions for the original features.

explain.description: If `true`, returns detailed information about score calculation as part of each hit.

params.description:
Key-value pairs used to replace Mustache variables in the template.
The key is the variable name.
The value is the variable value.

profile.description: If `true`, the query execution is profiled.

source.description:
An inline search template. Supports the same parameters as the search API's
request body. Also supports Mustache variables. If no id is specified, this
parameter is required.

role_descriptors.description: An array of role descriptors for this API key. This parameter is optional. When it is not specified or is an empty array, then the API key will have a point in time snapshot of permissions of the authenticated user. If you supply role descriptors then the resultant permissions would be an intersection of API keys permissions and authenticated userâ€™s permissions thereby limiting the access scope for API keys. The structure of role descriptor is the same as the request for create role API. For more details, see create or update roles API.

cluster.description: A list of the cluster privileges that you want to check.

aggregations.description:
Any aggregations to run over the corpus of returned API keys.
Aggregations and queries work together. Aggregations are computed only on the API keys that match the query.
This supports only a subset of aggregation types, namely: `terms`, `range`, `date_range`, `missing`,
`cardinality`, `value_count`, `composite`, `filter`, and `filters`.
Additionally, aggregations only run over the same subset of fields that query works with.

from.description:
Starting document offset.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the from and size parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

size.description:
The number of hits to return.
By default, you cannot page through more than 10,000 hits using the `from` and `size` parameters.
To page through more hits, use the `search_after` parameter.

catalog.description: Default catalog (cluster) for queries. If unspecified, the queries execute on the data in the local cluster only.

columnar.description: If true, the results in a columnar fashion: one row represents all the values of a certain column from the current page of results.

cursor.description:
Cursor used to retrieve a set of paginated results.
If you specify a cursor, the API only uses the `columnar` and `time_zone` request body parameters.
It ignores other request body parameters.

fetch_size.description: The maximum number of rows (or entries) to return in one response

field_multi_value_leniency.description: Throw an exception when encountering multiple values for a field (default) or be lenient and return the first value from the list (without any guarantees of what that will be - typically the first in natural ascending order).

params.description: Values for parameters in the query.

keep_on_completion.description: If true, Elasticsearch stores synchronous searches if you also specify the wait_for_completion_timeout parameter. If false, Elasticsearch only stores async searches that donâ€™t finish before the wait_for_completion_timeout.

index_using_frozen.description: If true, the search can run on frozen indices. Defaults to false.

fetch_size.description: The maximum number of rows (or entries) to return in one response.

size.description: How many matching terms to return.

case_insensitive.description: When true the provided search string is matched against index terms without case sensitivity.

string.description: The string after which terms in the index should be returned. Allows for a form of pagination if the last result from one request is passed as the search_after parameter for a subsequent request.

doc.description: An artificial document (a document not present in the index) for which you want to retrieve term vectors.

description.description: Free text description of the transform.

acknowledged.description: For a successful response, this value is always true. On failure, an exception is returned instead.

_types:Duration.description:
A duration. Units can be `nanos`, `micros`, `ms` (milliseconds), `s` (seconds), `m` (minutes), `h` (hours) and
`d` (days). Also accepts "0" without a unit and "-1" to indicate an unspecified value.

aggregations.description: Partial aggregations results, coming from the shards that have already completed the execution of the query.

num_reduce_phases.description:
Indicates how many reductions of the results have been performed.
If this number increases compared to the last retrieved results for a get asynch search request, you can expect additional results included in the search response.

value.description:
The metric value. A missing value generally means that there was no data to aggregate,
unless specified otherwise.

_types:GeoBounds.description:
A geo bounding box. It can be represented in various ways:
- as 4 top/bottom/left/right coordinates
- as 2 top_left / bottom_right points
- as 2 top_right / bottom_left points
- as a WKT bounding box

_types:GeoLocation.description:
A latitude/longitude as a 2 dimensional point. It can be represented in various ways:
- as a `{lat, long}` object
- as a geo hash value
- as a `[lon, lat]` array
- as a string in `"<lat>, <lon>"` or WKT point formats

_types.aggregations:BucketsHistogramBuck.description:
Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for
the different buckets, the result is a dictionary.

_types.aggregations:BucketsDateHistogram.description:
Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for
the different buckets, the result is a dictionary.

_types:DurationLarge.description:
A date histogram interval. Similar to `Duration` with additional units: `w` (week), `M` (month), `q` (quarter) and
`y` (year)

_types.aggregations:BucketsVariableWidth.description:
Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for
the different buckets, the result is a dictionary.

_types.aggregations:BucketsStringTermsBu.description:
Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for
the different buckets, the result is a dictionary.

_types.aggregations:BucketsLongTermsBuck.description:

_types.aggregations:BucketsDoubleTermsBu.description:
Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for
the different buckets, the result is a dictionary.

_types.aggregations:BucketsVoid.description:
Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for
the different buckets, the result is a dictionary.

_spec_utils:Void.description:
The absence of any type. This is commonly used in APIs that don't return a body.

Although "void" is generally used for the unit type that has only one value, this is to be interpreted as
the bottom type that has no value at all. Most languages have a unit type, but few have a bottom type.

See https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unit_type and https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bottom_type

_types.aggregations:BucketsLongRareTerms.description:
Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for
the different buckets, the result is a dictionary.

_types.aggregations:BucketsStringRareTer.description:
Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for

_types.aggregations:BucketsMultiTermsBuc.description:

_types.aggregations:BucketsGeoTileGridBu.description:

_types:GeoTile.description: A map tile reference, represented as `{zoom}/{x}/{y}`

Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for

_types.aggregations:BucketsRangeBucket.description:
Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for

key.description: The bucket key. Present if the aggregation is _not_ keyed

total.description: Total hit count information, present only if `track_total_hits` wasn't `false` in the search request.

_types:Field.description: Path to field or array of paths. Some API's support wildcards in the path to select multiple fields.

reason.description: A human-readable explanation of the error, in english

stack_trace.description: The server stack trace. Present only if the `error_trace=true` parameter was sent with the request.

_global.search._types:Context.description: Text or location that we want similar documents for or a lookup to a document's field for the text.

is_partial.description:
When the query is no longer running, this property indicates whether the search failed or was successfully completed on all shards.
While the query is running, `is_partial` is always set to `true`.

is_running.description:
Indicates whether the search is still running or has completed.
NOTE: If the search failed after some shards returned their results or the node that is coordinating the async search dies, results may be partial even though `is_running` is `false`.

_types:DateTime.description:
A date and time, either as a string whose format can depend on the context (defaulting to ISO 8601), or a
number of milliseconds since the Epoch. Elasticsearch accepts both as input, but will generally output a string
representation.

completion_status.description:
If the async search completed, this field shows the status code of the search.
For example, 200 indicates that the async search was successfully completed.
503 indicates that the async search was completed with an error.

_global.search._types:TrackHits.description:
Number of hits matching the query to count accurately. If true, the exact
number of hits is returned at the cost of some performance. If false, the
response does not include the total number of hits matching the query.
Defaults to 10,000 hits.

_global.search._types:SourceConfigParam.description:
Defines how to fetch a source. Fetching can be disabled entirely, or the source can be filtered.
Used as a query parameter along with the `_source_includes` and `_source_excludes` parameters.

aggregations.description:
Sub-aggregations for this aggregation.
Only applies to bucket aggregations.

filters.description:
Filters used to create buckets.
At least one filter is required.

separator.description: Separator used to concatenate filter names. Defaults to &.

fuzzy.description: Returns documents that contain terms similar to the search term, as measured by a Levenshtein edit distance.

intervals.description: Returns documents based on the order and proximity of matching terms.

match.description:
Returns documents that match a provided text, number, date or boolean value.
The provided text is analyzed before matching.

match_bool_prefix.description:
Analyzes its input and constructs a `bool` query from the terms.
Each term except the last is used in a `term` query.
The last term is used in a prefix query.

match_phrase.description: Analyzes the text and creates a phrase query out of the analyzed text.

match_phrase_prefix.description:
Returns documents that contain the words of a provided text, in the same order as provided.
The last term of the provided text is treated as a prefix, matching any words that begin with that term.

prefix.description: Returns documents that contain a specific prefix in a provided field.

range.description: Returns documents that contain terms within a provided range.

regexp.description: Returns documents that contain terms matching a regular expression.

term.description:
Returns documents that contain an exact term in a provided field.
To return a document, the query term must exactly match the queried field's value, including whitespace and capitalization.

terms_set.description:
Returns documents that contain a minimum number of exact terms in a provided field.
To return a document, a required number of terms must exactly match the field values, including whitespace and capitalization.

text_expansion.description: Uses a natural language processing model to convert the query text into a list of token-weight pairs which are then used in a query against a sparse vector or rank features field.

weighted_tokens.description: Supports returning text_expansion query results by sending in precomputed tokens with the query.

wildcard.description: Returns documents that contain terms matching a wildcard pattern.

filter.description:
The clause (query) must appear in matching documents.
However, unlike `must`, the score of the query will be ignored.

must.description: The clause (query) must appear in matching documents and will contribute to the score.

must_not.description:
The clause (query) must not appear in the matching documents.
Because scoring is ignored, a score of `0` is returned for all documents.

should.description: The clause (query) should appear in the matching document.

_types:MinimumShouldMatch.description: The minimum number of terms that should match as integer, percentage or range

boost.description:
Floating point number used to decrease or increase the relevance scores of the query.
Boost values are relative to the default value of 1.0.
A boost value between 0 and 1.0 decreases the relevance score.
A value greater than 1.0 increases the relevance score.

negative_boost.description: Floating point number between 0 and 1.0 used to decrease the relevance scores of documents matching the `negative` query.

fields.description: List of fields to search. Field wildcard patterns are allowed. Only `text` fields are supported, and they must all have the same search `analyzer`.

query.description:
Text to search for in the provided `fields`.
The `combined_fields` query analyzes the provided text before performing a search.

auto_generate_synonyms_phrase_query.description: If true, match phrase queries are automatically created for multi-term synonyms.

queries.description:
One or more query clauses.
Returned documents must match one or more of these queries.
If a document matches multiple queries, Elasticsearch uses the highest relevance score.

tie_breaker.description: Floating point number between 0 and 1.0 used to increase the relevance scores of documents matching multiple query clauses.

origin.description:
Date or point of origin used to calculate distances.
If the `field` value is a `date` or `date_nanos` field, the `origin` value must be a date.
Date Math, such as `now-1h`, is supported.
If the field value is a `geo_point` field, the `origin` value must be a geopoint.

pivot.description:
Distance from the `origin` at which relevance scores receive half of the `boost` value.
If the `field` value is a `date` or `date_nanos` field, the `pivot` value must be a time unit, such as `1h` or `10d`. If the `field` value is a `geo_point` field, the `pivot` value must be a distance unit, such as `1km` or `12m`.

functions.description: One or more functions that compute a new score for each document returned by the query.

max_boost.description: Restricts the new score to not exceed the provided limit.

min_score.description: Excludes documents that do not meet the provided score threshold.

factor.description: Optional factor to multiply the field value with.

missing.description:
Value used if the document doesnâ€™t have that field.
The modifier and factor are still applied to it as though it were read from the document.

params.description:
Specifies any named parameters that are passed into the script as variables.
Use parameters instead of hard-coded values to decrease compile time.

prefix_length.description: Number of beginning characters left unchanged when creating expansions.

transpositions.description: Indicates whether edits include transpositions of two adjacent characters (for example `ab` to `ba`).

value.description: Term you wish to find in the provided field.

ignore_unmapped.description:
Set to `true` to ignore an unmapped field and not match any documents for this query.
Set to `false` to throw an exception if the field is not mapped.

Set to `true` to ignore an unmapped field and not match any documents for this query.
Set to `false` to throw an exception if the field is not mapped.

Set to `false` to throw an exception if the field is not mapped.
Indicates whether to ignore an unmapped `type` and not return any documents instead of an error.

max_children.description:
Maximum number of child documents that match the query allowed for a returned parent document.
If the parent document exceeds this limit, it is excluded from the search results.

min_children.description:
Minimum number of child documents that match the query required to match the query for a returned parent document.
If the parent document does not meet this limit, it is excluded from the search results.

size.description: The maximum number of hits to return per `inner_hits`.

inner_hits.description: The number of inner hits and their sort order

max_concurrent_group_searches.description: The number of concurrent requests allowed to retrieve the inner_hits per group

format.description: Format in which the values are returned.

_types.analysis:StopWords.description:
Language value, such as _arabic_ or _thai_. Defaults to _english_.
Each language value corresponds to a predefined list of stop words in Lucene. See Stop words by language for supported language values and their stop words.
Also accepts an array of stop words.

boundary_chars.description: A string that contains each boundary character.

boundary_max_scan.description: How far to scan for boundary characters.

boundary_scanner_locale.description:
Controls which locale is used to search for sentence and word boundaries.
This parameter takes a form of a language tag, for example: `"en-US"`, `"fr-FR"`, `"ja-JP"`.

fragment_size.description: The size of the highlighted fragment in characters.

max_analyzed_offset.description:
If set to a non-negative value, highlighting stops at this defined maximum limit.
The rest of the text is not processed, thus not highlighted and no error is returned
The `max_analyzed_offset` query setting does not override the `index.highlight.max_analyzed_offset` setting, which prevails when itâ€™s set to lower value than the query setting.

no_match_size.description: The amount of text you want to return from the beginning of the field if there are no matching fragments to highlight.

number_of_fragments.description:
The maximum number of fragments to return.
If the number of fragments is set to `0`, no fragments are returned.
Instead, the entire field contents are highlighted and returned.
This can be handy when you need to highlight short texts such as a title or address, but fragmentation is not required.
If `number_of_fragments` is `0`, `fragment_size` is ignored.

phrase_limit.description:
Controls the number of matching phrases in a document that are considered.
Prevents the `fvh` highlighter from analyzing too many phrases and consuming too much memory.
When using `matched_fields`, `phrase_limit` phrases per matched field are considered. Raising the limit increases query time and consumes more memory.
Only supported by the `fvh` highlighter.

post_tags.description: Use in conjunction with `pre_tags` to define the HTML tags to use for the highlighted text. By default, highlighted text is wrapped in `` and `` tags.

pre_tags.description: Use in conjunction with `post_tags` to define the HTML tags to use for the highlighted text. By default, highlighted text is wrapped in `` and `` tags.

require_field_match.description:
By default, only fields that contains a query match are highlighted.
Set to `false` to highlight all fields.

_global.search._types:SourceConfig.description: Defines how to fetch a source. Fetching can be disabled entirely, or the source can be filtered.

ignore_unmapped.description:
Indicates whether to ignore an unmapped `parent_type` and not return any documents instead of an error.
You can use this parameter to query multiple indices that may not contain the `parent_type`.

score.description: Indicates whether the relevance score of a matching parent document is aggregated into its child documents.

intervals.description: An array of rules to combine. All rules must produce a match in a document for the overall source to match.

max_gaps.description:
Maximum number of positions between the matching terms.
Intervals produced by the rules further apart than this are not considered matches.

ordered.description: If `true`, intervals produced by the rules should appear in the order in which they are specified.

You can use this suffix to use a different analysis method for exact matches.

A set of flags that can be represented as a single enum value or a set of values that are encoded
as a pipe-separated string

Depending on the target language, code generators can use this hint to generate language specific
flags enum constructs and the corresponding (de-)serialization code.

The number of tokens from within the include span that canâ€™t have overlap with the exclude span.
Equivalent to setting both `pre` and `post`.

The query text you want to use for search.

Whether to perform pruning, omitting the non-significant tokens from the query to improve query performance.
If prune is true but the pruning_config is not specified, pruning will occur but default values will be used.
Default: false

query_vector.description:
Dictionary of precomputed sparse vectors and their associated weights.
Only one of inference_id or query_vector may be supplied in a request.

tokens_freq_ratio_threshold.description: Tokens whose frequency is more than this threshold times the average frequency of all tokens in the specified field are considered outliers and pruned.

tokens_weight_threshold.description: Tokens whose weight is less than this threshold are considered nonsignificant and pruned.

only_score_pruned_tokens.description: Whether to only score pruned tokens, vs only scoring kept tokens.

When `false`, the case sensitivity of matching depends on the underlying fieldâ€™s mapping.

format.description:

offset.description: Time zone specified as a ISO 8601 UTC offset.

`DecimalFormat` pattern for the output value.

_types.aggregations:BucketsPath.description:
Buckets path can be expressed in different ways, and an aggregation may accept some or all of these
forms depending on its type. Please refer to each aggregation's documentation to know what buckets
path forms they accept.

compression.description: Limits the maximum number of nodes used by the underlying TDigest algorithm to `20 * compression`, enabling control of memory usage and approximation error.

from.description: Buckets in positions prior to `from` will be truncated.

size.description:
The number of buckets to return.
Defaults to all buckets of the parent aggregation.

alternative.description:
A list of string values indicating which K-S test alternative to calculate. The valid values
are: "greater", "less", "two_sided". This parameter is key for determining the K-S statistic used
when calculating the K-S test. Default value is all possible alternative hypotheses.

fractions.description:
A list of doubles indicating the distribution of the samples with which to compare to the `buckets_path` results.
In typical usage this is the overall proportion of documents in each bucket, which is compared with the actual
document proportions in each bucket from the sibling aggregation counts. The default is to assume that overall
documents are uniformly distributed on these buckets, which they would be if one used equal percentiles of a
metric to define the bucket end points.

sampling_method.description:
Indicates the sampling methodology when calculating the K-S test. Note, this is sampling of the returned values.
This determines the cumulative distribution function (CDF) points used comparing the two samples. Default is
`upper_tail`, which emphasizes the upper end of the CDF points. Valid options are: `upper_tail`, `uniform`,
and `lower_tail`.

doc_count.description:
The total number of documents that initially created the expectations. Itâ€™s required to be greater
than or equal to the sum of all values in the buckets_path as this is the originating superset of data
to which the term values are correlated.

expectations.description:
An array of numbers with which to correlate the configured `bucket_path` values.
The length of this value must always equal the number of buckets returned by the `bucket_path`.

fractions.description:
An array of fractions to use when averaging and calculating variance. This should be used if
the pre-calculated data and the buckets_path have known gaps. The length of fractions, if provided,
must equal expectations.

precision_threshold.description:
A unique count below which counts are expected to be close to accurate.
This allows to trade memory for accuracy.

max_unique_tokens.description:
The maximum number of unique tokens at any position up to max_matched_tokens. Must be larger than 1.
Smaller values use less memory and create fewer categories. Larger values will use more memory and
create narrower categories. Max allowed value is 100.

max_matched_tokens.description:
The maximum number of token positions to match on before attempting to merge categories. Larger
values will use more memory and create narrower categories. Max allowed value is 100.

similarity_threshold.description:
The minimum percentage of tokens that must match for text to be added to the category bucket. Must
be between 1 and 100. The larger the value the narrower the categories. Larger values will increase memory
usage and create narrower categories.

categorization_filters.description:
This property expects an array of regular expressions. The expressions are used to filter out matching
sequences from the categorization field values. You can use this functionality to fine tune the categorization
by excluding sequences from consideration when categories are defined. For example, you can exclude SQL
statements that appear in your log files. This property cannot be used at the same time as categorization_analyzer.
If you only want to define simple regular expression filters that are applied prior to tokenization, setting
this property is the easiest method. If you also want to customize the tokenizer or post-tokenization filtering,
use the categorization_analyzer property instead and include the filters as pattern_replace character filters.

shard_size.description: The number of categorization buckets to return from each shard before merging all the results.

size.description: The number of buckets to return.

min_doc_count.description: The minimum number of documents in a bucket to be returned to the results.

shard_min_doc_count.description: The minimum number of documents in a bucket to be returned from the shard before merging.

size.description: The number of composite buckets that should be returned.

sources.description:
The value sources used to build composite buckets.
Keys are returned in the order of the `sources` definition.

format.description:
The date format used to format `key_as_string` in the response.
If no `format` is specified, the first date format specified in the field mapping is used.

min_doc_count.description:
Only returns buckets that have `min_doc_count` number of documents.
By default, all buckets between the first bucket that matches documents and the last one are returned.

keyed.description: Set to `true` to associate a unique string key with each bucket and return the ranges as a hash rather than an array.

_types.aggregations:FieldDateMath.description:
A date range limit, represented either as a DateMath expression or a number expressed
according to the target field's precision.

format.description: The date format used to format `from` and `to` in the response.

keyed.description: Set to `true` to associate a unique string key with each bucket and returns the ranges as a hash rather than an array.

key.description: Custom key to return the range with.

max_docs_per_value.description: Limits how many documents are permitted per choice of de-duplicating value.

shard_size.description: Limits how many top-scoring documents are collected in the sample processed on each shard.

sigma.description: The number of standard deviations above/below the mean to display.
The number of standard deviations above/below the mean to display.

minimum_set_size.description: The minimum size of one item set.

minimum_support.description: The minimum support of one item set.

size.description: The number of top item sets to return.

partition.description: The partition number for this request.

other_bucket.description: Set to `true` to add a bucket to the response which will contain all documents that do not match any of the given filters.

other_bucket_key.description: The key with which the other bucket is returned.

keyed.description:
By default, the named filters aggregation returns the buckets as an object.
Set to `false` to return the buckets as an array of objects.

_types.aggregations:BucketsQueryContaine.description:
Aggregation buckets. By default they are returned as an array, but if the aggregation has keys configured for
the different buckets, the result is a dictionary.

wrap_longitude.description: Specifies whether the bounding box should be allowed to overlap the international date line.

ranges.description: An array of ranges used to bucket documents.

key.description: Custom key to return the range with.

shard_size.description:
Allows for more accurate counting of the top cells returned in the final result the aggregation.
Defaults to returning `max(10,(size x number-of-shards))` buckets from each shard.

size.description: The maximum number of geohash buckets to return.

_types:GeoHashPrecision.description: A precision that can be expressed as a geohash length between 1 and 12, or a distance measure like "1km", "10m".

include_sort.description: When `true`, returns an additional array of the sort values in the feature properties.

size.description:
The maximum length of the line represented in the aggregation.
Valid sizes are between 1 and 10000.

shard_size.description:
Allows for more accurate counting of the top cells returned in the final result the aggregation.
Defaults to returning `max(10,(size x number-of-shards))` buckets from each shard.
